text: North Korea is the world's most
repressive regime the brutal Kim dynasty
which has been in control for over half
a century has presided over some of the
world's worst human rights abuses
talking to the ordinary people of North
Korea is virtually impossible
information coming out of the country is
strictly controlled by the regime
anybody going in is heavily policed
citizens can't move freely inside the
country or leave it working with a
covert network over many months we've
put questions to to ordinary citizens
living inside North Korea if the
authorities found out they'd spoken to
us they'd face imprisonment in one of
the regime's notorious labor camps or
death for that reason we've concealed
their identities and have taken steps to
ensure their continued anonymity eating
and living is a difficult people say
that Kim jong-un acts the same as us but
he takes away our money
some people do complain about their
everyday lives
some get caught by the State Security
Department for saying the wrong things
people cannot survive in the prison
camps once you go there you are no
longer citizen
I think this terror is what keeps
society going
[Music]
Cheol ho is a father who works in the
military son twee is a market trader who
lives with her husband and two daughters
these aren't their real names like many
market sellers she trades not just in
goods but also in black-market foreign
currency Chinese yen and dollars we
asked them about their daily life I wake
up it down around 5:30 because I need to
cook rice afterwards
I called the dollar black market and
find out the exchange rate i breakfast
with the family then I organized the
goods to sell at the market and had
their I usually lunch at the market nan
minutos potato noodles a chip after
lunch I checked the market rights to see
what the pop light himself I then come
home and check the inventory then I
prepare dinner when the business is good
wheat rice three times a day when it
isn't so good we have to mix Conan with
the rice we mostly buy from the market
sometimes we buy bark from nearby
farmers
[Music]
sometimes in night I watch Korean drama
or foreign films and usually sleep at
about 10 o'clock our people are nice we
have a saying the neighbours of better
than cousins
if something happens to our neighbors we
visit each other but eating and living
is difficult there are no such things as
weekend's there is not much to watch on
TV and no time to stay at home if I have
spare time I go wood cutting
[Music]
despite being closed off from much of
the outside world and crippled by
economic sanctions there are thriving
markets with goods brought in both
legally and illegally via China foreign
media like films and TV shows are
popular something the regime fights hard
to prevent as it undermined their anti
Western propaganda the smugglers may
meet every day if there is a business or
maybe just once a week to a monthly
Korean things are the most popular of
course but the crackdown on them strong
I've heard the cost of bribes if you're
caught is huge but people still wants to
watch them it's easy to understand and
people are curious about how South
Korean leaf but they come watch it every
day we watch your once in a blue moon
I have heard in some places if you have
money you can pay to have a Chinese TV
station installed for about 600 Chinese
rubia that's equivalent to around 70
pounds a fortune to North Koreans whose
average annual income is estimated to be
less than a thousand pounds
the State Security Department are known
as the Bowie Boonton North Koreans
they're the Iron Fist of the regime
they're known for demanding outrageous
bribes for small infractions as well as
policing everyday citizens for signs of
dissent
dissent in North Korea includes things
like criticizing the regime trying to
defect or making contact with anybody
outside the country these crimes can
result in detention in a hard labor camp
known as the gulags or in extreme cases
public execution punishment isn't
restricted to the accused in North Korea
three generations of their family can be
sentenced as retribution for one
person's actions sometimes people get
caught by the stated security department
the boy Wu for saying the wrong things
people do suddenly disappear
[Music]
but he hasn't happened here recently
sometimes the State Security Department
get people by calling them spies for
their own result they make up stories
for their own performance I myself don't
know what happens in the cans because
the Bui boo deal with them
[Music]
we can't talk about the March when a
neighbor disappears we just say he went
to low town meaning South Korea
affection doesn't happen here much I
heard that happens a lot in the border
areas
here there are a lot of government
captures people arrested and taken away
the people shouldn't commit a crime
people cannot survive in the prison
camps they unconditionally bid you
they starve you while doing extreme
labor
once you go there you are no longer a
citizen I think this terror is what
keeps society going
[Music]
Kim jong-un became the leader of North
Korea in the wake of his father's death
in 2011 he's the third ruler in the
dynastic kim dictatorship it's a cult of
personality with the leaders portrayed
as godlike figures the youngest Kim
stands accused of leading a regime just
as brutal as his father and grandfather
he allegedly ordered the murders of his
uncle and half-brother whilst allowing
the unfettered powers of the security
services to continue hearing any kind of
public criticism of Kim jong-un in North
Korea is exceptionally rare in fact it's
illegal to publicly criticize him or any
of his family mostly people criticize
Kim jong-un for being a businessman
people say that Kim jong-un acts the
same as us but takes away our money a
lot that the little man uses his head to
suck up money like a vampire but the
number of people who assess him
positively is increasing in the 1990s
North Korea experienced a famine that
left over a million people dead when the
state couldn't fund its ration system in
response black markets emerged across
the country today they serve as a
lifeline to the population with the
regime reluctantly allowing this
capitalist trade to grow according to
the UN 40 percent of the population is
undernourished and without these markets
they'd starve
he leaves the markets alone and doesn't
crack down much no matter what we do
many people want things to continue the
way it is and internally there appears
to be a softening in rhetoric towards
the West
I've heard that the market that the
president of us is coming people don't
know much about the meeting but everyone
dislike America we say the reason for us
living in poverty is because America
split us and sealed us off but things
are changing a little recently they say
we should get along with the south
recently they say we should be living in
peace with America for everyone to have
a better life I'm not sure what
foreigners think about North Korea there
is only North Koreans here I myself hope
to live where without envy until we die
without being sick with parents being
healthy and my children living well
[Music]
